content:
• Tuesday, July 3, 2018
  • IPG

    S&P puts negative outlook on Interpublic Group after Acxiom deal

    • S&P has put a negative ratings outlook on Interpublic Group (NYSE:IPG) after the company's $2.3B deal to buy the data-marketing unit of Acxiom (NYSE:ACXM).
    • The firm expects debt financing for the deal that would increase leverage.
    • It's got a BBB corporate credit rating currently.
    • Interpublic shares fell 3.1% today, while Acxiom shares rose 15.3% in the short session.
    • Previously: Acxiom +5.4% as Stephens sets high price target after deal (Jul. 03 2018)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM
  • RRTS

    After Hours Gainers / Losers (07/03/2018)

    • Top Gainers: RRTS +4.4%. GBR +3.8%. CDAY +3.6%. AMRN +2.5%. SGH +2.1%.
    • Top Losers: GES -3.9%. KKR -3.2%. SDRL -3.2%. CZZ -2.6%. VSH -2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:13 PM | 3 Comments
  • CHTR

    Charter's wireless service goes live, joining Comcast

    • Charter Communications' (NASDAQ:CHTR) new wireless service, Spectrum Mobile, has gone live.
    • As expected after the company formed an alliance with fellow top cableco Comcast (NASDAQ:CMCSA), the service relies on the same MVNO agreement that powers Comcast's Xfinity Mobile and offers similar flexible pricing.
    • Customers can pay for data by usage, or a flat $45 per month per line for unlimited data. On the per-usage option, Charter's plan charges $14/GB/month while Comcast's is $12/GB/month.
    • CHTR rose 1.9% during the short session today; CMCSA dropped 0.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:07 PM
  • LOOP

    More on Loop Industries Q1 resuts

    • Loop Industries (LOOP +1.1%) reported a Q1 net loss of $3.5M (+133.3% Y/Y), due to increased R&D and G&A expenses.
    • Q1 Expenses: R&D $1.06M (+114.7% Y/Y) reflecting higher non-cash-stock-based compensation and G&A $2.35M (+164.8% Y/Y) reflecting higher legal, consulting & accounting fees and commercialization efforts.
    • Company has a cash balance of $5.4M as on May 31, 2018.
    • “Since the last quarter we have activated our Generation II depolymerization technology, designed the world’s first waste to Loop™ PET resin manufacturing technology, hired Nelson Switzer, the former Chief Sustainability Officer of Nestlé Waters and Nestlé USA to assume the role of Chief Growth Officer, and advanced our discussion with manufacturing partners to begin the production of Loop™ PET resin”, said Daniel Solomita, Founder and CEO.
    • Previously: Loop Industries reports Q1 results (July 3)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:10 PM
  • WLBAQ

    Westmoreland Coal to stop making debt payments

    • Westmoreland Coal (WLBA -14%) discloses it will defer making ~$15M in interest payments on its 8.75% senior secured notes due 2022.
    • WLB says supporting noteholders have agreed to not deliver any notice or instruction directing the trustee to exercise any of the rights and remedies under the credit agreement with respect to any default caused by the failure to pay interest.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM | 1 Comment
  • TSLA

    Spotlight on Tesla's Model 3 quality tests

    • Tesla (TSLA -6.7%) CEO Elon Musk asked engineers to halt putting Model 3 vehicles through a standard brake and roll alignment test sometimes on June 26, according to a report from Business Insider that relies on internal documents from the company.
    • BI notes that it's unclear what procedure that could "adequately replace" the brake and roll test on a manufacturing line or how many cars were impacted if the step was truly skipped.
    • Fairly or unfairly, the EV automaker's assembly line methods have been a focus this week amid the "burst production" push to finish off Q2 - although bullish-leaning analysts see manufacturing and margin benefits at scale down the road as the company goes through its learning curve.
    • "To be extremely clear, we drive *every* Model 3 on our test track to verify braking, torque, squeal, and rattle," responds a Tesla spokesperson to the BI reveal.
    • The BI story increases the odds that Model 3 road tests, reviews and anecdotal reports from owners on quality will be making the rounds.
    • Previously: Burst of selling pressure on Tesla (July 3)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM | 430 Comments
  • SSC-OLD

    SSC sets $283M 'Chain Valley' in Connecticut; shares +12.7%

    • In continuing moves toward establishing a U.S. presence, Seven Stars Cloud (SSC +12.7%) will set up a global headquarters for technology and innovation in Connecticut, at a former UConn campus in West Hartford.
    • The project is planned for $283M and the company says it expects to create 330 jobs over five years.
    • It's contingent on SSC buying the two contiguous campus properties. It plans rehab of some structures, razing others and "modest" new construction.
    • The blockchain-pivoting company is referring to the area as "Chain Valley."
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM | 11 Comments
  • CYH

    Community Health continues selloff, down 2%

    • Community Health Systems (CYH -2.4%) continues its slide, although up from the intraday low of $2.82. Shares have lost 34% of their value since touching $4.64 on June 20.
    • Today, Piper's Sarah James cautioned that the company and fellow hospital operator Tenet Healthcare (THC +1.7%) face "tough comps" in their respective turnaround efforts, adding that Street estimates for adjusted admissions are too high.
    • Last week, Bloomberg Intelligence's Mike Holland wrote that CYH bondholders should "remain vigilant" citing concerns with the company's ability to make enough credit-accretive sales to grow into its capital structure. Future debt refinancings are probable if EBITDA erodes.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:39 PM | 2 Comments
  • TUWLF

    Judge orders Tullow Oil to pay Seadrill $254M in fees over Ghana dispute

    • Tullow Oil (OTCPK:TUWLF, OTCPK:TUWOY) says a London judge has ordered it to pay rig owner Seadrill (NYSE:SDRL) a contract termination fee and other standby fees totaling $254M, ruling that Tullow was wrong to cancel a rig contract in 2016 after Ghana's government set a drilling moratorium on its TEN offshore oil and gas field located in waters then claimed by both Ghana and Ivory Coast.
    • Tullow, which owns 47% of TEN, says its net share of fees totals ~$140M; the company said last week it set aside $128M for the dispute with SDRL and that it would decide within three weeks whether it would appeal the ruling.
    • Meanwhile, TEN partner Kosmos Energy (NYSE:KOS) is disputing its share of responsibility for the fees and is seeking arbitration at the International Chamber of Commerce, which might result in Tullow having to pay the fees for KOS's 20% stake in the field, or ~$50M.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:37 PM | 30 Comments
  • VEON

    Technology - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 12:30 PM (07/03/2018)

    • Gainers: VEON +17%. ACXM +16%. AYI +13%. MARK +13%. ACMR +9%.
    • Losers: BBOX -36%. OTCPK:LFIN -15%. HQCL -10%. MFGP -8%. AMRH -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:30 PM
  • UMC

    Micron -3.5% on preliminary injunction from Chinese court (update)

    • UMC (NYSE:UMC) announces that a Chinese court has ruled in its favor in patent infringement lawsuits against Micron (NASDAQ:MU).
    • The court has issued a preliminary injunction against Micron that blocks the company from selling 26 DRAM and NAND related items in the PRC.
    • Barred items include certain solid-state hard drives and memory sticks.
    • UMC shares are up 0.9% to $2.92.
    • Micron shares are down 3.5% to $52.60.
    • Update: Micron tells CNBC that it hasn't been served the preliminary injunction and won't comment further until it has seen and reviewed the documentation.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:25 PM | 796 Comments
  • BESVF

    Rough session for optical names after warning from BE Semiconductor

    • BE Semiconductor (OTC:BESVF) tumbled nearly 10% in Europe after cutting Q2 guidance. That, in turn, is hitting AMS to tune of 6.3%, with Northern Trust noting the soft high-end smartphone market hitting BE Semi.
    • American players: Oclaro (OCLR -2.3%), Lumentum (LITE -5.3%), II-VI (IIVI -3.2%)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:21 PM | 12 Comments
  • BJ

    IPO market starts to heat up

    • The 55 IPOs during the second quarter were the most since Q2 of 2015, according to compiling from Ipreo.
    • The $14.2B in IPO proceeds during the quarter was the highest since Q4 of 2014.
    • The largest IPO during the period was BJ's Wholesale Club (NYSE:BJ), which brought in $733M and trades about 47% over its pricing level of $17 after rallying 6.3% today.
    • Other IPOs trading well above their pricing include Neuronetics (NASDAQ:STIM) +56% and Lovesac (NASDAQ:LOVE) +29%.
    • Related ETFs: FPX, IPO, IPOS, FPXI.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:21 PM
  • SHIP

    More on Seanergy Maritime's Q1 results

    • Seanergy Maritime Holdings (SHIP -0.4%) reported Q1 revenue growth of 60.1% Y/Y to $21.32M due to higher average daily charter rates earned, and the addition of the M/V Partnership to the fleet.
    • Q1 operating margin recovered by 2,829 bps to 8.17% and EBITDA margin recovered by 2,222 bps to 21.75%.
    • Q1 fleet utilization was at 99.7% with TEC rate at $11,712 (+91.8% Y/Y) and daily vessel operating expense rate of $5,114 (+10% Y/Y).
    • In June 2018 company entered into a $26.5M sale and leaseback transaction for the M/V Knightship with a Chinese leasing institution and a $24.5M loan agreement for M/V Lordship for refinancing outstanding indebtedness under the previous loan facility with Northern Shipping Funds.
    • Presently the company has cargo-carrying capacity of ~1,682,582 dwt and an average fleet age of 9.2 years.
    • "In the first quarter of 2018 the market increased materially in terms of the daily average earnings of the Baltic Capesize Index as compared to the same period in 2017, mainly due to the dramatic reduction in newbuilding deliveries, which is expected to continue for the foreseeable future. Overall we expect the seaborne transportation of iron ore and coal to increase by 3% to 4% on an annual basis while the historically low order book should facilitate a substantial increase in freight rates," commented Stamatis Tsantanis, Chairman and CEO.
    • Previously: Seanergy Maritime reports Q1 results (July 3)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:04 PM | 3 Comments
  • ESPR

    Esperion up 10% ahead of investor event

    • Esperion Therapeutics (ESPR +9.5%) is up on below-average volume ahead of its Analyst and Investor Event on Tuesday, July 10, in NYC. The event will focus on the company's bempedoic acid franchise, including an update on its Phase 3 studies.
    • Previously: Esperion Therapeutics halted pending news (May 23)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM
  • AMTX

    Energy/Materials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 12:00 PM (07/03/2018)

    • Gainers: AMTX +26%. USEG +16%. MXC +13%. BRN +11%. YPF +9%.
    • Losers: GBR -28%. PED -6%. ZKIN -6%. LGCY -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:00 PM
  • OCUL

    Ocular Therapeutix (again) refiles U.S. marketing application for Dextenza

    • Expecting the third time to be the charm, Ocular Therapeutix (OCUL -2.6%) has resubmitted its New Drug Application to the FDA seeking approval for DEXTENZA (dexamethasone insert) 0.4 mg for the treatment of ocular pain following ophthalmic surgery.
    • The company received a second CRL in July 2017 citing manufacturing deficiencies. It received the first CRL in July 2016 also citing manufacturing issues.
    • Previously: Ocular Therapeutix -30% as FDA denies NDA for Dextenza (July 11, 2017)
    • Previously: FDA rejects Ocular's Dextenza NDA for ocular pain; shares off 4% premarket (July 25, 2016)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:53 AM | 9 Comments
  • VEON

    VEON: There were tailwinds before the Italy deal

    • Shares of VEON (NASDAQ:VEON) (formally VimpelCom) are +17.5% after agreeing to sell its 50% stake in Italy-based telecommunications company Wind Tre to CK Hutchison for €2.45B ($2.85B).
    • Analysts were quick to upgrade the ADRs following the announcement.
    • Joshua Hall, a long-time bull, earlier this year suggested there was upside for the stock. His reasons:
    • 1) Currency tailwinds.
    • 2) Its new digital strategy.
    • 3) Its exposure to Belt and Road emerging and frontier markets.
    • Having said that, the fact that VEON's fortunes are so bound up by the currency fluctuations in the countries it does business in (Russia, Pakistan, Algeria, Ukraine, Bangladesh, Uzbekistan) mean it's not a holding for the feint of heart.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:45 AM | 3 Comments
  • AYI

    Acuity Brands - there's more upside

    • Acuity Brands (NYSE:AYI) is +15% after a strong FQ3 earnings beat.
    • Is there upside? Authors suggest there is:
    • In an April article, Sergio Heiber noted the company remains the market share leader in a promising industry; management is very shareholder friendly, and the company is trading at historic low valuations.
    • While management has been less than stellar in forecasting earnings, for which the stock has been punished, "they have an excellent record of growing revenue and earnings."
    • In the article, he suggests "waiting for a solid earnings report indicating that AYI's game plan is catching on," adding, "Applying a PE of 16 to analysts' estimates results in a stock price of about $155."
    • Also worth reading is Arthur Frentzel's Depressed LED Players Set For A Rebound.
    • Looking at our Peers feature, I was able to find AYI peers that are up in sympathy: HUBB +2.9%. CREE +5.6%. EFOI +2.3%. RVLT +2.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:32 AM | 2 Comments
  • PBR

    Petrobras suspends some asset sales following court ruling

    • Petrobras (PBR +2.6%) says it is suspending some asset sales after a Brazil Supreme Court justice ruled that privatizations must be approved by Congress.
    • While considering which legal actions to take, PBR discloses it will suspend the sale of refineries, gas pipeline company Transportadora Associada de Gas and the Araucaria fertilizer factory.
    • The TAG sale process is in its final stages, and PBR is discussing contracts with France's Engie and is expected to submit the deal for rebids by two other groups interested in the acquisition.
    • Separately, PBR says it made a $983M deposit as part of a deal to settle a class action in the U.S.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:31 AM | 1 Comment
  • BMA

    Financials - Top Gainers / Losers as of 11:30 AM (07/03/2018)

    • Gainers: BMA +13%. BFR +12%. SUPV +11%. IRS +9%. ELVT +7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:30 AM
  • TSLA

    Burst of selling pressure on Tesla

    • Tesla (NASDAQ:TSLA) is down 4.98% as shares drop to their lowest level since June 8.
    • A couple of notes from bearish-leaning firms Goldman Sachs (Sell, $195 PT) and JPMorgan (Underweight, $180 PT) are in the mix. Goldman calls the incremental color on Model 3 net reservations incrementally negative, while JP is somewhat suspicious of the "burst production" method used by Tesla to hit its 5K Model 3/week number.
    • While the takes from analysts are for the most part retreads of their prior pieces, an inside look at the Fremont assembly line posted by Reuters is a fresh look at the factory floor during the Model 3 production ramp that is creating some buzz.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:22 AM | 476 Comments
  • ALB

    Albemarle +4% as Goldman Sachs calls lithium selloff overdone

    • Albemarle (ALB +4.5%) shoots higher after Goldman Sachs upgrades shares to Buy from Neutral with a $125 price target and reiterates a Buy rating on FMC Corp. (FMC +1.6%), saying the selloff in companies tied to lithium is overdone.
    • Goldman believes investor concerns about a wave of supply of the electric car battery material from new mines are unfounded, it will be harder to develop new lithium mines that most people think, and demand for lithium could rise fourfold by 2025 due to rising sales of electric cars.
    • “Coupled with ongoing rising demand expectations as auto OEMs look to electrify their fleets, we expect lithium markets to remain sufficiently tight to handsomely reward incumbent producers,” Goldman says.
    • Also, SQM +2.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:20 AM | 15 Comments
  • AVXL

    Midday Gainers / Losers (07/03/2018)

    • Gainers: AVXL +35%. MXC +32%. JNP +31%. MICT +28%. AMTX +27%. UONE +19%. VEON +16%. NITE +16%. ACXM +15%. AZZ +15%.
    • Losers: BBOX -27%. GBR -24%. OTCPK:LFIN -16%. TYHT -10%. TTNP -10%. EPZM -9%. ORMP -9%. DEST -8%. BLNK -8%. MFGP -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:17 AM | 2 Comments
  • SCG

    SCANA files federal lawsuit over South Carolina 15% rate cut

    • SCANA's (SCG +2.9%) South Carolina Electric & Gas said yesterday it had filed a federal lawsuit seeking to block state regulators from following a newly passed law to temporarily cut bills for the utility's power customers by 15%, but the state's Public Service Commission voted to enact the rate cut anyway.
    • In the lawsuit, SCE&G says the law is unconstitutional and complains that South Carolina lawmakers passed a 2007 law encouraging the V.C. Summer nuclear expansion project and appointed state regulators who approved it but now wants to punish the utility because the project failed.
    • The suit was filed Friday, a day after the rate cut law was enacted, but released to the public late yesterday; PSC commissioners then voted unanimously to put the 15% rate cut into effect and will reconvene today to discuss the specifics of imposing the rate.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:05 AM | 31 Comments
  • MLHR

    Consumer - Top Gainers / Losers as of 11:00 AM (07/03/2018)

    • Gainers: MLHR +9%. LFVN +7%. XELB +7%. SORL +6%.
    • Losers: ADOM -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM
  • MLHR

    Herman Miller up 8% post Q4 results

    • Herman Miller (MLHR +8%) reports Q4 revenue growth of 7.1% Y/Y to $618M of which, North America $309.2M (-3.7% Y/Y); ELA $125.4M (+35.4% Y/Y); Specialty $83.2M (+13% Y/Y) & Consumer $100.2M (+11.3% Y/Y).
    • Overall Q4 margins: Gross declined 140 bps to 36.9%; Adj. operating declined 180 bps to 8.4% & Adj. EBITDA declined 160 bps to 11.6%
    • Segment Adj. Operating margin: North America declined 470 bps to 11.2%; ELA increased 260 bps to 12.2%; Specialty declined 70 bps to 3.8% & Consumer increased 450 bps to 8.4%.
    • Segment Adj. EBIDTA margin: North America declined 420 bps to 14.2%; ELA increased 200 bps to 14.4%; Specialty declined 30 bps to 7.6% & Consumer increased 460 bps to 11.5%.
    • Orders were $620.8M (+9.3% Y/Y) & Backlog of $344.5M (+6.8% Y/Y).
    • Cash & equivalents increased 112% Y/Y to $203.9M.
    • The Company announced an increase of 10% in cash dividend to $0.1975 per share payable in October 2018.
    • Q1 2019 Outlook: Revenue of $610-630M; Gross Margin of 36.3%-37.3%; Adjusted Operating expenses of $175-179M; effective tax rate of 21-23%; Organic sales growth of 6% & EPS of $0.63-0.67.
    • Previously: Herman Miller beats by $0.08, beats on revenue (July 2)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:55 AM | 1 Comment

  • So long $75 crude oil

    • Crude oil futures, which breached $75/barrel earlier this morning for the first time since 2014, drop off a cliff after Al Jazeera reports that Saudi has agreed to U.S. demands to pump more oil.
    • "Saudi Arabia's cabinet on Tuesday endorsed the kindgdom's readiness to pump more oil to maintain market balance and stability, the official Saudi Press Agency said."
    • "The kingdom is prepared to utilize its spare production capacity when necessary to deal with any future changes in the levels of supply and demand."
    • On Saturday, President Trump said Saudi Arabia's King Salman had agreed to his request to increase oil output "maybe up to" two million barrels.
    • Crude futures currently at $73, -1.1% on the day.
    • Top crude oil ETFs by AUM: USO, UCO, DBO, DWT, UWT, SCO, UWTIF, USL.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:47 AM | 117 Comments
  • MFGP

    Micro Focus -6.7%, pulling back from yesterday's gains

    • Micro Focus (NYSE:MFGP) shares are down 6.7%, pulling back from yesterday’s gains that followed the announced sale of its SUSE business.
    • Micro Focus shares are up 3% in the past week, down 0.5% in the past month, and down 47.4% YTD.  
    • Previously: Micro Focus +5.4% on $2.5B SUSE business sale (July 2)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:45 AM | 1 Comment
  • MTG

    MGIC Investment, First Data, Ambac rise as BTIG likes their H2 prospects

    • MGIC Investment (MTG +1.3%), First Data (FDC +1.5%), and Ambac (AMBC +0.5%) all gain in morning trading after BTIG analyst Mark Palmer finds the three financial stocks particularly attractive at 2018's midpoint.
    • Ambac's agreement with holders of a majority of its auction market preferred shares--AMPS-- bodes well for the company's shares, as does a recent ruling on its representation and warranty litigation against Bank of America.
    • Potential catalysts for AMBC:
      Emerging clarity on the treatment of COFINA senior sales tax bonds in Puerto Rico's debt restructuring--which represents about 40% of AMBC's net insured exposure to the island's debt;
      Settling the BAC R&w litigation could provide AMBC with the cash it could use to deleverage. A settlement could come sooner, rather than later, Palmer writes.
    • For First Data, Palmer sees free cash flow allowing
      FDC to reduce net leverage ratio to 5.0x at YE2018 from 5.8x at March 31.
    • FDC shares, which trade at 10.7x consensus FY19E EV/EBITDA, should benefit from multiple expansion as net leverage decreases, increasing the value of its equity, and it demonstrates ability to sustain revenue growth in the mid-single digits, Palmer writes.
    • Concerns about MGIC Investment should wane as changes in leadership in agencies overseeing the U.S. housing market should give investors more confidence that the government will cede more of the mortgage insurance space to the private insurers, he writes.
    • And Palmer sees premium rates stabilizing. "We have heard nothing to support the notion that the PMIs are looking to implement premium rate cuts beyond those already announced," he writes.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:31 AM | 9 Comments
  • JNP

    Healthcare - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 10:30 AM (07/03/2018)

    • Gainers: JNP +31%. NITE +17%. AVXL +15%. VRAY +10%. XBIO +8%.
    • Losers: TTNP -10%. ORMP -9%. GEMP -7%. NEPT -6%. SELB -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM
  • SELB

    Shkreli likes Selecta Bio, shares down 8%

    • Incarceration apparently is no hindrance for publishing stock picks by Pharma Bad Boy Martin Shkreli.  A couple of days ago, he blogged that he "likes Selecta Biosciences" (SELB -7.5%) citing the potential for gout candidate SEL-212 to take new patient starts away from Horizon Pharmaceuticals' (HZNP +0.5%) KRYSTEXXA (pegloticase).
    • In Q1, KRYSTEXXA sales were $46.7M, accounting for almost 21% of Horizon's net revenue of $223.9M.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:29 AM | 8 Comments
  • VEON

    New Street upgrades Veon to Buy after Italy deal

    • New Street has upgraded Veon's ADRs (VEON +18.6%) to Buy in the wake of the company's deal to sell its stake in Italy's Wind Tre to CK Hutchison, and move to buy assets in Pakistan and Bangladesh.
    • The firm's Alastair Jones has set Veon's price target to $3.90, implying 38% upside from today's higher price.
    • ADRs have been down nearly 38% YTD.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:29 AM | 6 Comments
  • MICT

    Micronet Enertec Technologies +31% after BNN acquires stake

    • Micronet Enertec Technologies (NASDAQ:MICT) pops 31% to $1.65 after BNN Technology acquired a 14.89% stake in the company.
    • BNN will buy an additional 35% stake through a third-party cash tender offer of at least $1.65/share. 
    • MICT will acquire BNN and an unrelated third party PaaS company in exchange for cash and shares.  
     
     
     
     
    | 10:13 AM
  • AGCBF

    Amarillo Gold announces completion of the sale of an NSR Royalty

    • Amarillo Gold (OTCQB:AGCBF -18.6%) completes the sale of a perpetual 1.75% Net Smelter Return Royalty on the Mara Rosa gold project to RG Royalties for USD$10.8M.
    • The proceeds of the sale are expected to be used to repay a portion of the gold-linked credit facility and to fund ongoing exploration and development activities of the Mara Rosa Project.
    • CEO of Amarillo, Mike Mutchler: “We are extremely pleased to have completed the sale of the Royalty. It represents a compelling way for Amarillo to realize significant cash proceeds that will further strengthen our balance sheet and help fund the continued advancement of the Mara Rosa Project.”
     
     
     
     
    | 10:12 AM
  • TTNP

    Titan Pharma advances Phase 1/2 study of ropinirole in Parkinson's

    • Titan Pharmaceuticals (TTNP -7.6%) announces that it is ready to enroll the second cohort of patients in its Phase 1/2 clinical trial evaluating its ropinirole implant for the treatment of the signs and symptoms of Parkinson's disease. The advancement of the study was based on a review of data from the first cohort by the independent Data Safety Monitoring Board.
    • The company says its top priority remains the commercial launch of its Probuphine implant for the maintenance treatment of opioid addiction so it will start the enrollment of the second cohort "as resources allow" which appears to be reason for the selloff.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:11 AM | 5 Comments
  • VSH

    Vishay Intertechnology +3.6% on double upgrade

    • Citi double upgrades Vishay Intertechnology (NYSE:VSH) from Sell to Buy.
    • Vishay shares are up 3.6% to $24.50.       
     
     
     
     
    | 9:47 AM
  • RAMP

    Acxiom +5.4% as Stephens sets high price target after deal

    • Acxiom (NYSE:ACXM) is up 5.4% premarket after last night's confirmation of a deal to sell most of itself to Interpublic Group (NYSE:IPG) for $2.3B.
    • Acxiom's gotten a Street-high price target of $44 from Stephens, up from $36 and implying 29% upside. The company got a "remarkable" price for its data marketing business, which had a number of headwinds including customer losses and regulatory hurdles.
    • Meanwhile, the deal enhances IPG's practices and the company may be able to contain regulatory risk by de-emphasizing first-party data collection in the future, says Wells Fargo's Peter Stabler. He has a Market Perform rating on IPG and a price target of $26, implying 13% upside. (h/t Bloomberg)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM
  • GLCNF

    ETFs with Glencore exposure

    • In case you're wondering, here are ETFs with exposure to Glencore (OTCPK:GLCNF), which fell as much as 15% in London this morning and is currently down 7.3% after it received a DOJ subpoena regarding money laundering.
    • PICK (6.7%)
    • COPX (4.9%)
    • GNR (3.6%)
    • BATT (3% and 4.4% exposure to Glencore subsidiary KAT CH)
    • GUNR (2.9%)
    • MXI (2.8%)
    • EWU (2.1%)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM | 1 Comment
  • SQ

    Square continues rise after Susquehanna increases earnings estimate

    • Square (NYSE:SQ) gains 0.7% in premarket trading after Susquehanna analyst James Friedman raised his earnings estimates and his price target, according to Bloomberg News.
    • Friedman lifts price target to $74 from $53 and and boosts 2018 and 2019 revenue and EBITDA estimates on higher long-term margins and its e-commerce expansions through its Weebly buy.
    • Previously: Square downgraded by Stephens after rally; analyst likes PayPal instead (June 26)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM | 3 Comments
  • DAL

    Delta Air Lines updates on traffic and Q2 guidance

    • Delta Air Lines (NYSE:DAL) reports revenue passenger miles rose 3.0% to 21.447B in June. Capacity was also up 3.0% during the month to 24.230B available seat miles.
    • The airline's load factor was flat at 88.5% as a 30 basis point improvement on international flights offset a 20 bp decline for domestic flights.
    • Delta continues to expect Q2 EPS of $1.65 to $1.75, a range with a midpoint slightly short of the consensus analyst estimate of $1.73. A pre-tax margin rate of 13% to 14% is also anticipated.
    • Shares of Delta are down 2.26% in premarket trading.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:17 AM | 2 Comments

  • BIDU

    NAR: Baidu, SoftBank partner on self-driving buses in Japan

    • Baidu (NASDAQ:BIDU) partners with SoftBank (OTCPK:SFTBF, OTCPK:SFTBY) to enter Japan’s self-driving bus market with plans to start vehicle testing by the end of the year, according to Nikkei Asian Review.
    • China’s Xiamen King Long United Automotive will build the bus. The companies hope to ship ten buses by 2019 and to begin commercialization at a later date. 
    • SoftBank is participating through its SB Drive business, which has already started testing self-driving busses at the Fukushima nuclear power plant and Tokyo’s Haneda Airport. 
    • Baidu’s Apollo project develops an autonomous vehicle platform with partners including Ford, Honda, and about 100 other global companies. 
    • Baidu shares are up 1% premarket to $248.72. 
     
     
     
     
    | 8:50 AM | 5 Comments
  • AAL

    Deutsche Bank on hold with U.S. airlines

    • Deutsche Bank heads into the 4th of July weekend with a coolish take on the airline sector.
    • The analyst team lowers American Airlines Group (NASDAQ:AAL), Delta Air Lines (NYSE:DAL), and United Continental (NASDAQ:UAL) to Hold from Buy after its research shows that airlines underperform during periods of increased geopolitical and macroeconomic disruption.
    • Another drag on the sector is the lower level of airline fares as competition in key markets drives prices down.
    • UAL, AAL and DAL are all down about 1% in premarket trading.
    • Previously: Airline fares drop in the U.S. (July 3)

  • AYI

    Acquity Brands +13.5 % on earnings beat

    • Acuity Brands (NYSE:AYI) reports revenue rose 5% in Q3, due to ~10% increase in volume and and a combined 1% favorable impact from acquisitions and foreign exchange rate changes.
    • Sales of LED-based products represented two-third of total net sales.
    • Gross margin rate down 90 bps to 41.6%.
    • Adjusted SD&A expense rate improved 130 bps to 27.2%.
    • Adjusted operating margin rate squeezed 220 bps 14.4%.
    • The Company entered into a new credit agreement with a syndicate of banks that increased the Company’s borrowing capacity under such agreement to $800M from $250M.
    • AYI +13.56% premarket.
    • Previously: Acuity Brands beats by $0.21, beats on revenue (July 3)

    Veon +19% following sale of Wind Tre stake for $2.85B

    • Veon (NASDAQ:VEON) +19.2% premarket after agreeing to sell its 50% stake in Italy-based telecommunications company Wind Tre to CK Hutchison for €2.45B ($2.85B).
    • Veon expects to book a net profit of $1.1B on the sale and plans to use the proceeds to pay down debt, support its dividend policy and pursue other strategic alternatives.

  • AVXL

    Anavex on go with Phase 2b/3 study of ANAVEX 2-73 in Alzheimer's

    • Anavex Life Sciences (NASDAQ:AVXL) has received approval from Australian regulators to launch a Phase 2b/3 clinical trial assessing ANAVEX 2-73 in patients with early-stage Alzheimer's disease.
    • The 450-subject 48-week study will commence next month.
    • Orally available ANAVEX 2-73 is a sigma-1 receptor (S1R) agonist. S1Rs play a key role in the modulation of neurotransmission.
    • Previously: Anavex's lead product candidate successful in mid-stage Alzheimer's study; shares ahead 8% premarket (Dec. 8, 2016)

    Glencore -9% after DoJ subpoenas documents in corruption probe

    • Glencore (OTCPK:GLCNF, OTCPK:GLNCY) -9.6% in London trading after the U.S. Justice Department demands records related to compliance with laws against foreign corrupt practices and money laundering concerning its business in the Democratic Republic of Congo, Nigeria and Venezuela.
    • The company says the subpoena was dated July 2 and relates to its operations in the three countries from 2007 to the present.
    • Since the U.S. government subpoena covers several countries, it indicates “there is a relatively thorough investigation at hand,” says RBC Capital analyst Tyler Broda.
